meanings.definition: Keeping careful watch for possible danger or difficulties.
meanings.sent1: The vigilant guard noticed the approaching storm clouds.
meanings.sent2: She remained vigilant during the hike to avoid getting lost.
meanings.sent3: The vigilant squirrel kept an eye on the sneaky raccoon trying to steal its nuts.
meanings.sent4: His vigilant eyes scanned the dark alley for any signs of movement.
meanings.sent5: The vigilant cat's ears perked up at the sound of a distant meow.

meanings.definition: Alertly watchful to avoid danger or harm.
meanings.sent1: The vigilant driver quickly slammed on the brakes to avoid the red light runner.
meanings.sent2: The lifeguard remained vigilant to ensure swimmers were safe in the pool.
meanings.sent3: The vigilant student dodged the flying paper airplane aimed at their head.
meanings.sent4: Her vigilant instincts kicked in when she heard a strange noise in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The vigilant firefighter rushed into the burning building to save the trapped family.

meanings.definition: Watchful and alert to detect danger or crime.
meanings.sent1: The vigilant police officer patrolled the neighborhood to prevent any criminal activity.
meanings.sent2: The security camera system was set up to keep a vigilant eye on the store at all times.
meanings.sent3: The vigilant neighbor noticed the suspicious behavior and called the authorities.
meanings.sent4: Her vigilant gaze scanned the crowded room for any signs of trouble.
meanings.sent5: The vigilant watchdog barked loudly at the sound of footsteps outside.
